intro: Uncaria bulusanensis, commonly known as the Bulusan climbing vine, is a species native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its twining stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers, followed by red berries that contain the seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
